thread.title: Justin Bieber pokes fun at his nude images
thread.title_full: Justin Bieber pokes fun at his nude images - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Justin Bieber pokes fun at his nude images
text:
Singer Justin Bieber is no longer upset about his nude photographs taken during a vacation in Bora Bora.
READ: Justin Bieber, `1D` share same release date
"That was shrinkage for me," Bieber told accesshollywood.com.
However, the 'Baby' hitmaker admitted that he was completely unhappy the first time he learned that his nude images surfaced online.
For latest Music updates follow us on Twitter >>> @TOIEntertain
"My first thing was like, 'how can they do this?' Like, I feel super violated," he said.
Bieber also explained how much he wanted freedom and privacy in his life.
For the latest in Music news, like us on Facebook >>> TOIEntertain
"I feel like I can't step outside and feel like I can go outside naked. Like, you should feel comfortable in your own space... especially that far away," he confessed.
Listen to Justin Bieber on Gaana.com
WATCH: Justin Bieber Threatens Lawsuits After Nude Pic Scandal
Justin Bieber: Never Say Never Amazon.in : INR 111.00 Buy now Justin Bieber arrested in Miami of 6 Police in Miami Beach say pop singer Justin Bieber has been arrested and is accused of drunken driving and drag racing. (AP)
See more of: Justin Bieber The Miami Beach Police Department confirmed 19-year-old Bieber's arrest Thursday morning in a tweet on its official Twitter page. (Reuters)
See more of: Justin Bieber Police say the pop star was drag racing on Miami Beach early Thursday. (AP)
See more of: Justin Bieber Officials at the Miami-Dade Department of Corrections say Bieber has not yet been booked into jail. (AP)
See more of: Justin Bieber The arrest comes on the heels of another controversy for Bieber. Officials have said that detectives in California recently searched Bieber's home looking for surveillance footage that might serve as evidence the pop star was involved in an egg-tossing vandalism case that caused thousands of dollars in damage to a neighbour's home. (Reuters)
